intro: Satureja anachoreta, commonly known as Armenian thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountains of Armenia and the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant and have been traditionally used in local cuisines and herbal remedies. Satureja anachoreta thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
